verses.verse: And the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Speak<WH559> unto the priests<WH3548> the sons<WH1121> of Aaron<WH175>, and say<WH559> unto them<WH2930>, There shall none be defiled for the dead<WH5315> among his people<WH5971>:
But for his kin<WH7607>, that is near<WH7138> unto him<WH517>, that is, for his mother, and for his father<WH1>, and for his son<WH1121>, and for his daughter<WH1323>, and for his brother<WH251>,
And for his sister<WH269> a virgin<WH1330>, that is near<WH7138> unto him<WH376>, which has had no husband; for her may he be defiled<WH2930>.
But he shall not defile<WH2930> himself<WH1167>, being a chief man among his people<WH5971>, to profane himself<WH2490>.

They shall not make<WH7139> baldness<WH7144> upon their head<WH7218>, neither shall they shave off<WH1548> the corner<WH6285> of their beard<WH2206>, nor make<WH8295> any cuttings<WH8296> in their flesh<WH1320>.

They shall be holy<WH6944> unto their God<WH430>, and not profane<WH2490> the name<WH8034> of their God<WH430>: for the offerings<WH801> of the Lord<WH3068> made by fire<WH801>, and the bread<WH3899> of their God<WH430>, they do offer<WH7126>: therefore they shall be holy<WH6918>.

They shall not take<WH3947> a wife<WH802> that is a whore<WH2181>, or profane<WH2491>; neither shall they take<WH3947> a woman<WH802> put away<WH1644> from her husband<WH376>: for he is holy<WH6918> unto his God<WH430>.

You shall sanctify<WH6942> him therefore<WH7126>; for he offers the bread<WH3899> of your God<WH430>: he shall be holy<WH6918> unto you for I the Lord<WH3068>, which sanctify<WH6942> you<WH6918>, am holy.
And the daughter<WH1323> of any<WH376> priest<WH3548>, if she profane<WH2490> herself by playing the whore<WH2181>, she profanes<WH2490> her father<WH1>: she shall be burnt<WH8313> with fire<WH784>.

And he that is the high<WH1419> priest<WH3548> among his brothers<WH251>, upon whose head<WH7218> the anointing<WH4888> oil<WH8081> was poured<WH3332>, and that is consecrated<WH4390> to put<WH3847> on the garments<WH899>, shall not uncover<WH6544> his head<WH7218>, nor tear<WH6533> his clothes<WH899>;
Neither shall he go in<WH935> to any dead<WH4191> body<WH5315>, nor defile<WH2930> himself for his father<WH1>, or for his mother<WH517>;

Neither shall he go out<WH3318> of the sanctuary<WH4720>, nor profane<WH2490> the sanctuary<WH4720> of his God<WH430>; for the crown<WH5145> of the anointing<WH4888> oil<WH8081> of his God<WH430> is upon him<WH3068>: I am the Lord.
And he shall take<WH3947> a wife<WH802> in her virginity<WH1331>.

A widow<WH490>, or a divorced woman<WH1644>, or profane<WH2491>, or an prostitute<WH2181>, these shall he not take<WH3947>: but he shall take<WH3947> a virgin<WH1330> of his own people<WH5971> to wife<WH802>.
Neither shall he profane<WH2490> his seed<WH2233> among his people<WH5971>: for I the Lord<WH3068> do sanctify him<WH6942>.
And the Lord<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> unto Moses<WH4872>, saying<WH559>,

Speak<WH1696> unto Aaron<WH175>, saying<WH559>, Whoever<WH376> he be of your seed<WH2233> in their generations<WH1755> that has any blemish<WH3971>, let him not approach<WH7126> to offer<WH7126> the bread<WH3899> of his God<WH430>.

For whatever man<WH376> he be that has a blemish<WH3971>, he shall not approach<WH7126>: a blind<WH5787> man<WH376>, or a lame<WH6455>, or he that has a flat nose<WH2763>, or any thing deformity<WH8311>,
Or a man<WH376> that is brokenfooted<WH7667>, or brokenhanded<WH7667>,
Or hunch-backed<WH1384>, or a dwarf<WH1851>, or that has a blemish<WH8400> in his eye<WH5869>, or has scurvy<WH1618>, or scabbed<WH3217>, or has his stones<WH810> broken<WH4790>;

No man<WH376> that has a blemish<WH3971> of the seed<WH2233> of Aaron<WH175> the priest<WH3548> shall come near<WH5066> to offer<WH7126> the offerings<WH801> of the Lord<WH3068> made by fire<WH801>: he has a blemish<WH3971>; he shall not come near<WH5066> to offer<WH7126> the bread<WH3899> of his God<WH430>.
He shall eat<WH398> the bread<WH3899> of his God<WH430>, both of the most<WH6944> holy<WH6944>, and of the holy<WH6944>.

Only he shall not go in<WH935> unto the veil<WH6532>, nor come near<WH5066> unto the altar<WH4196>, because he has a blemish<WH3971>; that he profane<WH2490> not my sanctuaries<WH4720>: for I the Lord<WH3068> do sanctify them<WH6942>.
And Moses<WH4872> told<WH1696> it unto Aaron<WH175>, and to his sons<WH1121>, and unto all the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>.
